thread.title: Injured Auburn backup center Xavier Dampeer "doing OK"
thread.title_full: Injured Auburn backup center Xavier Dampeer "doing OK"

title: Injured Auburn backup center Xavier Dampeer "doing OK"
text:
Injured Auburn backup center Xavier Dampeer "doing OK" Tools By Alabama News Network 
Story Created: Oct 11, 2015 at 7:02 PM CDT 
Auburn, AL - Offensive Coorindator Rhett Lashlee spoke to the media Sunday night, and said backup center Xavier Dampeer is "doing ok." 

When asked if Dampeer would play against Kentucky this Thursday, Lashlee said, " I don't know at this point." 
When asked who would be the 2nd team center if Dampeer can't play, Lashlee added, "We have several options that we've discussed throughout the summer, so we don't want to divulge into that too much" 

A source close to the Auburn football program told Alabama News Network sports reporter Christina Chambers that Xavier Dampeer had his jaw injured after being punched in a bar fight last Sunday. 
According to a hospital worker, Dampper was in Outpatient Services at the East Alabama Medical Center last Wednesday, and was treated and released. 
Last Wednesday, Al.com reported that dismissed Auburn wide receiver Duke Williams punched four people at SkyBar after being thrown out of the bar early Sunday morning. 
The source close to the Auburn football program indicates Dampeer was one of William's alleged victims. 
The Auburn Police Department said Williams has not been accused of any criminal act and has not been charged. 
Auburn coach Gus Malzahn dismissed WIlliams from the team last Monday, but did not specifically say why he was kicked off. 
Alabama News Network Sports has reached out to Auburn University Athletics and Duke Williams. Neither have returned text messages or phone calls regarding the alleged incident. 
Stay with the Alabama News Network Sports team as this story unfolds.
